item.title: 10 Reasons You Could be a Recruiter
item.description: Often times, those who are successful in recruiting have just "fallen into it". With 40+ years of combined recuriting experience we’ve identified 10 traits that most successful recruiters have in common. In fact, you might have the majority of those traits yourself and if you do - then consider recruiting as a career!
item.content:encoded: Often times, those who are successful in recruiting have just "fallen into it". With 40+ years of combined recuriting experience we’ve identified 10 traits that most successful recruiters have in common. In fact, you might have the majority of those traits yourself and if you do - then consider recruiting as a career!
item.author: PeopleFirstRecruiting@slideshare.net(PeopleFirstRecruiting)

item.title: Google Tech Talk: Productivity, happiness, and avoiding sudden death
item.description: Video live at: http://youtu.be/UnZlyouz9s8 . Presented Dec 14, 2012 at Google. Here are the links that illustrate the techniques I mention: * notifymenot.com - Turn off your notifications from social networks * bit.ly/mobileoff - Turn off the badges/alerts on your phone * awayfind.com - Receive alerts for just your important emails, and download the full Guide to NOT Checking Email (part of AwayFind’s setup) * snipr.com/makealist - Clear your head, get started with a system * bit.ly/thecriticalpath - Determine what tasks are critical for your major goals * bit.ly/bodyslave - Schedule your day around your energy levels * bit.ly/remarkablenotproductive - Nevermind productivity, be remarkable If you’d like more information or are interested in a similar talk for your organization, drop me a note: jared@awayfind.com. Please follow me on Twitter: @technotheory.
item.content:encoded: Video live at: http://youtu.be/UnZlyouz9s8 . Presented Dec 14, 2012 at Google. Here are the links that illustrate the techniques I mention: * notifymenot.com - Turn off your notifications from social networks * bit.ly/mobileoff - Turn off the badges/alerts on your phone * awayfind.com - Receive alerts for just your important emails, and download the full Guide to NOT Checking Email (part of AwayFind’s setup) * snipr.com/makealist - Clear your head, get started with a system * bit.ly/thecriticalpath - Determine what tasks are critical for your major goals * bit.ly/bodyslave - Schedule your day around your energy levels * bit.ly/remarkablenotproductive - Nevermind productivity, be remarkable If you’d like more information or are interested in a similar talk for your organization, drop me a note: jared@awayfind.com. Please follow me on Twitter: @technotheory.
item.author: technotheory@slideshare.net(technotheory)

media:content.media:title: Google Tech Talk: Productivity, happiness, and avoiding sudden death
media:content.media:description:
Video live at: http://youtu.be/UnZlyouz9s8 . Presented Dec 14, 2012 at Google. Here are the links that illustrate the techniques I mention:
* notifymenot.com - Turn off your notifications from social networks * bit.ly/mobileoff - Turn off the badges/alerts on your phone * awayfind.com - Receive alerts for just your important emails, and download the full Guide to NOT Checking Email (part of AwayFind's setup) * snipr.com/makealist - Clear your head, get started with a system * bit.ly/thecriticalpath - Determine what tasks are critical for your major goals * bit.ly/bodyslave - Schedule your day around your energy levels * bit.ly/remarkablenotproductive - Nevermind productivity, be remarkable
If you'd like more information or are interested in a similar talk for your organization, drop me a note: jared@awayfind.com.
Please follow me on Twitter: @technotheory.

Here are the links that illustrate the techniques I mention: * notifymenot.com - Turn off your notifications from social networks * bit.ly/mobileoff - Turn off the badges/alerts on your phone * awayfind.com - Receive alerts for just your important emails, and download the full Guide to NOT Checking Email (part of AwayFind’s setup) * snipr.com/makealist - Clear your head, get started with a system * bit.ly/thecriticalpath - Determine what tasks are critical for your major goals * bit.ly/bodyslave - Schedule your day around your energy levels * bit.ly/remarkablenotproductive - Nevermind productivity, be remarkable If you’d like more information or are interested in a similar talk for your organization, drop me a note: jared@awayfind.com. Please follow me on Twitter: @technotheory.

item.title: The Future Of Music
item.description: By identifying the forces at play in the world of music and the behaviors that are driving those forces, one can identify particular patterns that support current trends. By looking forward to what the future of music may encompass, this presentation aims to provide Carhartt, with valuable insight that will help the brand as a whole, cater to the future of urban millenials.
item.content:encoded: By identifying the forces at play in the world of music and the behaviors that are driving those forces, one can identify particular patterns that support current trends. By looking forward to what the future of music may encompass, this presentation aims to provide Carhartt, with valuable insight that will help the brand as a whole, cater to the future of urban millenials.

item.title: Mobile economy report: 2012 stats, predictions and trends
item.description: Mobile is the first order priority device for access, because it’s always with you, always connected. The desktop’s at the office. The tablet’s at the house. The TV’s at the house. You’re generally not watching TV during the day, but the smartphone is always with you. From mobile usage data to trends and latest news, this ebook should get you up to date with all the new things and we’re sure it will convince you it’s time to go mobile. Feel free to use this presentation in your company if you are trying to convince decision makers to invest in mobile or contact us if you need more advice on the first steps.
item.content:encoded: Mobile is the first order priority device for access, because it’s always with you, always connected. The desktop’s at the office. The tablet’s at the house. From mobile usage data to trends and latest news, this ebook should get you up to date with all the new things and we’re sure it will convince you it’s time to go mobile. Feel free to use this presentation in your company if you are trying to convince decision makers to invest in mobile or contact us if you need more advice on the first steps.

From mobile usage data to trends and latest news, this ebook should get you up to date with all the new things and we’re sure it will convince you it’s time to go mobile.
Feel free to use this presentation in your company if you are trying to convince decision makers to invest in mobile or contact us if you need more advice on the first steps.

item.title: Mindful Eating for Mere Mortals
item.description: Being in control of How we eat is a super habit, that can save us a lot of extra pounds, and help us stay focused during periods of Stress. Mindful Eating, although it might helpful to some, may not be the easiest start for most of us. Find out an easier way to start taking control of How you eat.
item.content:encoded: Being in control of How we eat is a super habit, that can save us a lot of extra pounds, and help us stay focused during periods of Stress. Mindful Eating, although it might helpful to some, may not be the easiest start for most of us. Find out an easier way to start taking control of How you eat.

item.title: Leweb Paris 2012; a visual overview in iPad sketchnotes
item.description: An overview in visuals of the most important keynote speakers at Leweb 2012 Paris. These are live iPadsketches made while the speakers where on stage and tweeted and posted as soon as they where ready. Bundled in this overview to give ou a quick summary of LeWebs main stage during the 3 busy days of the conference.

item.title: Sharpen your point
item.description: Every slide has a point. Even the bad ones. If you don’t make one, people will assume one. So half the battle in building slide decks, (and creating compelling messages) is figuring out what the point really is. Here’s a slideshare that shows you how.
item.content:encoded: Every slide has a point. Even the bad ones. If you don’t make one, people will assume one. So half the battle in building slide decks, (and creating compelling messages) is figuring out what the point really is. Here’s a slideshare that shows you how.

item.title: JWT: 10 Trends for 2013 - Executive Summary
item.description: In our eighth annual forecast of trends for the near future, new technology continues to take center stage. Many of our trends reflect how businesses are driving, leveraging or counteracting its omnipresence in our lives, and how consumers are responding to its pull. We also put a spotlight on health, with two separate trends examining the rising awareness around the impact of stress and happiness on well-being and how businesses are addressing it. As a companion to our full-report, we’ve created an Executive Summary presentation. To read more about JWT’s "10 Trends for 2013" or to purchase the report, visit JWTIntelligence.com.
